title: Support items should just get a massive overhaul at this point
body:
Every year there always seems to be some kind of fuckery that appears that involves support items being abused by solo laners or carries.

Season 5: Sightstone on junglers 
Season 6: Spellthiefs mid lane for income/sustain
Season 7: Ardent + ADC Relic
Season 8: Relic, but was eventually removed EDIT: S8 Top laners also used coin
Season 9: Klepto and Spellthiefs 

Year after year support items are given nice new things only to be abused by non supports which eventually end up with them getting nerf to the trash can all together. Year after year supports and their items have received more nerfs than any QoL or buffs. Every year there seems to be some kind of issue with support items and solo laners abusing them and at this point I'd rather you overhaul the entire thing than look for more nerfs.

With recent changes to Spellthiefs and Coin these are massively the most horrendous changes that could have ever went live. You're literally tying a support to an ally, what's even the point of playing a self sufficient AP support anymore when you can't even proc the tribute damage alone. That's not even the worst of your problems, what happens if your ADC is constantly dying in lane and you don't have an ally around to farm gold?

The first changes for removal of sight stone and incorporating the 500g was already bad enough as I had a couple of games where I can't even interact with my lane and have to wait almost nearly 20 mins just to complete my freaking item.

https://imgur.com/a/7ADcpoZ

But now if you're in a shitty lane match up where you can't poke or you'll die or your getting camped you make literally 0 gold. 

Just overhaul the items already and start new they've been balancing nightmares for a long time now.

I'm in the camp that loves offmeta creativity, within certain limits. I have no opposition to people skimping on CS if they have an alternate path to get the win. 

That said; i still think the game will never reach a stable item balance if we keep giving supports (and to a lesser extent tank items) cheap, gimped down items. Raise the costs on them as well as the stats, make income items unique to the support role as well as buffing them, and let players across all roles choose what items they want looking at defensive or offensive, personal or team passives and actives that don't ever stack.

Problem solved.

Honestly the entire item system would be easier to balance if they were just grouped by class.  Not every champion needs to have access to every item for the game to work.  Soraka doesn't need access to items like Tiamat, and Fiora doesn't need access to items like Spellthief's Edge.

If each class had it's own group of items, and a list of generic items that everyone can use, balancing the items would become so much easier.

Just like marksman items, support items are constantly having to be balanced around the fact that someone outside of their intended role might use them, and that's a really lousy metric to balance against.  

Imagine how good you could make tank MR items if champions like LeBlanc couldnt take them.  Imagine how much easier it would be to balance gold income items if only support champions could get them.

The feature of everyone having access to every item isn't worth balancing around, especially when Riot is going to intercede anyways when stuff like Tank Ekko or Top Viktor spout up.

I just want to be able to play support with items that are cleanly tailored for the role, outside of the shield items please.

You're barking up a tree I sort of hinted at a while back: Go the Heroes of the Storm Route. Make everyone have no items, but individual power ups. The odyssey mode was a good way to do talent-based system, too.

Honestly that would be good too, because 99% of the time as a support, I'm literally just buying the same 3 items every game, regardless of the team compositions.  All of the stat gains from equipment might as well be gated behind experience levels, as it would basically deliver the same experience.

If there aren't any meaningful choices for me on my equipment, then why does the system even exist in the first place?

For Off-Meta Fuckery

AP Udyrs, AP Nasus (ARAM), ADC Annie was a thing for a while several seasons ago, Crittlesticks was hilarious once upon a time, on-hit Soraka with her silence to counter Riven, etc.

While I agree the game would be much easier to balance if all items weren't available for all champs, it does come at the sacrifice of fun, off-meta builds & playstyles that the community has embraced throughout the years.

This would contradict the very spine of this game, which is "adapt by buying items". I know META etc etc etc, but you still can go ADC soraka (not that you should). At some point Garen often bought DFG, to ump his ultimate damage. With your suggestion it'd never be the case. There are few more examples of classes buying "wrong items" for synergy. Overall I'd prefer not changing that. If anything it's a shame Riot themselves contradicted this by limiting our build paths with "unique" gimmick on items. 5x sunfirecape Eve, oh I miss you so much :(

There are other ways around the issue we should explore first imo :)

The thing is tho, at least from the support role, there are very few efficient items for me to buy to adapt to.

If I want to stack defensive stats and shield bonuses.  There are no items for that

If I want to stack defensive stats with Ability Power and some team utility there are no items like that.

Or what if I just want some defensive utility found in other items?  A GA effect would be really fun on a squish support, but the stats on GA are tuned for other champions.  Why can't there be a cheap support item that has the passive from Abyssal Mask, so I can synergize with a mage carry like Cassiopeia?

Bruisers get to have key items like Black Cleaver and Spear of Shojin which basically give them everything they need, then they can branch out into shit like Maw or Steraks, depending on what they are facing.  Support cant have any items like that because they would be "abused" by solo laners.

If every champ pool had their own group of items, you could start experimenting a lot more with them, because the number of champions you would have to account for is less than 120.

>Honestly the entire item system would be easier to balance if they were just grouped by class. Not every champion needs to have access to every item for the game to work. Soraka doesn't need access to items like Tiamat, and Fiora doesn't need access to items like Spellthief's Edge.

Would perhaps remove the last bit of fun from the game. Things like AP Shyvana,  AS Lulu, etc. would be removed (some of this offmeta picks can be annyoing to play against but they have some drawbacks which make them not competitive viable). Also it would be problematic since some champs use items from other classes (some marksmen use lethality items which are ad assassine items, mage supports use both support and mage items). And champs can´t be picked offrole as a counter (MF support used by pro).

We simply need more and better designed items. Does someone actually builds this {{item:3030}}? Even it´s previous users like A Sol probably abandoned it. Why is {{item:3285}}  almost must buy and {{item:3027}}  no real alternative to {{item:3285}} ? Why do ap bruisers lack items to build? Why do crit users have one mandatory item ({{item:3031}},previously {{item:3095}}, and previously again {{item:3031}} )?

Edit: Restrictions for items make sense but they should be the exception not the rule.

I agree.  I should also elaborate more.  I'm not intending to say that we take items away from champs - I'm saying that each champ class should have a pool of weapons, and within those pools, there should also be some off-meta items for players to experiment with.

The state of items right now is insanely boring, because they have to be balanced against 120 different kits, so they have to be either insanely narrow in who can efficiently use it, or its just so generic and bland that it doesn't really require any strategic thought around it.

If Riot had to balance items around 20-ish champions, instead of 120, they would they get all of the items into a balanced state more quickly, which in turn would give them time to experiment with off-meta items.

I think item experimentation is great and yea, give Shyvana some AP options for a dragon breath build.  If you wanted to design a great AP item for Shyvana, it would a lot easier knowing that only melee champions like her or Diana or Sylas would be able to use it, instead of worrying if it would bring out something broken like Tank Fizz or Tank Ekko.

I know it sounds counter-intuitive, but the more boundaries you put around areas of a game, the more you can start creating real areas of specialization and experimentation.  Just think about the cool items you could build if you know that it would only be shared with similarly styled champions.

Also, your analogy of tying Heal to the Precision tree doesn't work. Runes aren't items, and to date, there is no correlation between summoner spells and runes aside from Unsealed Spellbook.
